newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products flat, gasoline softer on UK budge.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products flat, gasoline softer on UK budge.

text.p: NWE oil products were largely unchanged on Monday and little business was done with markets in the U.S. and the U.K. shut for public holidays, traders said.
Eurograde gasoline barges were valued by one trader as being a shade weaker than the $212 paid late on Friday, although numbers were very notional. "Make of that number what you will," he said.
British newspapers said over the weekend their new Labour government's first budget, which is expected to include a duty increase on gasoline, may be delayed from June 10 to June 25 or even July 2.

Traders said this delay would exert a downwards pressure on prompt gasoline barge prices and ease the front-month backwardation in the swaps markets as a number of players had already started to hoard duty-paid gasoline in anticipation of the budget.
"There is no point stockpiling it now and paying for tankage if it is going to sit there for a few more weeks," one player said. "So I expect to see a bit more selling in the short term."
Heating oil was lacklustre, and flat.
High sulphur fuel oil barges were also little changed and valued at around $80/$82 fob ARA. Dealers fear increasing exports of Russian barrels may soon exert a downwards pressure on prices.
